Key Match Events: The match between India and Canada was abandoned due to unplayable ground conditions.
Umpires inspected the pitch and consulted with the groundsman before deciding to call off the game.
Large dryers were used to work on wet patches, but the pitch remained unplayable.
Pre-Game Insights: India's T20 World Cup campaign moved to Florida for their final group stage match before the Super 8s in the Caribbean.
The batters were eager for a proper hit-out to sharpen their skills for the upcoming knockout stages.
Rain showers disrupted the schedule in Florida, causing delays.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The outfield remained saturated with soggy patches, requiring significant effort from the groundstaff.
A scheduled inspection at 10:30 AM confirmed a delay for the originally planned 10:00 AM toss.
